findings.title: Double spending
findings.description: Since the signatures for the NativeToERC and ERC20ToERC20 (home to foreign) transfers are not different in any way, they can be used to cause double spending.

findings.title: Contract does not prevent accidental token transferring
findings.description: The transfer method does not prevent token transferring to ForeignBridgeNativeToErc, but in this case the UserRequestForAffirmation(userAddr, value) event will not be fired.

findings.title: Possible Denial of Service
findings.description: No description provided in the audit report fragment.

findings.title: Function does not generate the event
findings.description: The initialize function sets the requiredSignatures var but does not generate the RequiredSignaturesChanged(requiredSignatures); event.

findings.title: No message checking
findings.description: The submitSignature function in BasicHomeBridge.sol contract does not check the message entities, allowing an attacker to spoof recipient or value by a MITM attack.

findings.title: Possible Validators/RequiredSignatures desync
findings.description: Because there is no on-chain way to sync the “Home” and “Foreign” sides in terms of “current Validators list” and/or RequiredSignatures , Validator Software should notify of any desync and stop Bridge trade if it happens.
